newsitem.title: USA: Innkeepers to acquire Residence Inn hotels.
newsitem.headline: Innkeepers to acquire Residence Inn hotels.

text.p: Innkeepers USA Trust said Friday it would acquire seven of the nine Residence Inn hotels that are owned by partnerships for $110 million.
Innkeepers said it would buy the hotels as a package, paying about $65 million in cash and about $45 million in operating partnership units to the partnerships controlled by Jack DeBoer.
It said it would also buy the other two hotels but did not elaborate.
Innkeepers said Marriott International Inc would manage the hotels.
Marriott, which specializes in lodging and services management, had agreed to manage other Residence Inn hotels that it could buy in the future, it said.
Innkeepers also said it would acquire from Marriott the Residence Inn in Portland, Maine, for $6,163,000.
Innkeepers, a real estate investment trust, already owns 11 hotels operating as Residence Inn hotels under franchise agreements with Marriott.
It said the new acquisitions would make it one of the largest owners of Residence Inn hotels in the country.
